title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones. Tiny changes, remarkable results. No matter your goals, Atomic Habits offers a proven framework for improving every day.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: A reclusive Hollywood icon finally tells her story to a young journalist, revealing her scandalous life, her seven marriages, and the price of fame and love.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A mystery about a young woman who raised herself in the marshes of the deep South, becoming a suspect in a murder case.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set in the distant future amidst a feudal interstellar society, this epic tale follows young Paul Atreides as his family becomes embroiled in a war for control of the desert planet Arrakis.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: Former First Lady Michelle Obama's deeply personal memoir describing her journey from childhood to the White House.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: A lone astronaut must save humanity in this science-packed thriller that combines hard science with an engaging story.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: Between life and death there is a library, and within that library, the shelves go on forever. Every book provides a chance to try another life you could have lived.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Set during World War II in Germany, this is the story of Liesel Meminger, a foster girl living outside of Munich, who scratches out a meager existence by stealing books.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: The story of Circe, the nymph from Homer's Odyssey, who discovers her power of witchcraft and must choose between the gods and mortals.

title: Klara and the Sun
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
description: From the Nobel Prize-winning author comes this beautiful story about an artificial friend's journey to understand the human heart.

title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
description: A tale of gods, kings, immortal fame and the human heart, The Song of Achilles is a dazzling literary feat that brilliantly reimagines Homer's enduring masterwork, The Iliad.

title: The Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
description: A landmark novel that chronicles the journey of an African American man's search for identity and meaning in a society that refuses to see him.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
description: A story of mutual fascination, friendship and love following Connell and Marianne from different backgrounds through their years at Trinity College Dublin.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: The classic tale of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy, exploring themes of marriage, money, and social class in Regency England.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel about totalitarian control, surveillance, and the individual's struggle against an oppressive state.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
description: The beloved story of the four March sisters - Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy - growing up during the Civil War.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the beloved series about a young wizard discovering his magical heritage and attending Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: Set in the Jazz Age on prosperous Long Island, this novel captures the decadence and idealism of the Roaring Twenties through the story of Jay Gatsby.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where women's rights have been stripped away and fertility is controlled by the state.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence told through the eyes of Scout Finch in Depression-era Alabama.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A journalist and a hacker investigate a wealthy family's dark secrets in this gripping Swedish crime thriller.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A powerful story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's tumultuous history.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A psychological thriller about a marriage gone terribly wrong when Amy Dunne disappears on her fifth wedding anniversary.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: A love story between two teenagers who meet in a cancer support group - funny, sad, and inspiring all at once.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The epic fantasy adventure following Frodo Baggins and the Fellowship as they journey to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenager who has been expelled from prep school and wanders around New York City.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a technologically advanced future where society is rigidly controlled through technology and conditioning.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
author: Ken Kesey
description: The story of Randle Patrick McMurphy and his battle against the oppressive Nurse Ratched in a mental institution.

title: Outlander
author: Diana Gabaldon
description: A WWII combat nurse is mysteriously swept back in time to 18th-century Scotland, where she meets a Highland warrior.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comic science fiction adventure following Arthur Dent as he travels through space after Earth is destroyed to make way for a hyperspace bypass.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopian future, teenagers are forced to fight to the death in televised games as entertainment for the Capitol.

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: A collection of twelve detective stories featuring the brilliant Sherlock Holmes and his loyal companion Dr. Watson.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A symbologist gets caught up in a deadly conspiracy involving secret societies, religious history, and hidden codes.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A young man survives 227 days stranded on a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a Bengal tiger named Richard Parker.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd boy's journey to find treasure leads him to discover the importance of following one's dreams and personal legend.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
description: The story of Celie, an African American woman in the early 20th century South, and her journey from oppression to empowerment.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A haunting story about slavery's legacy, following Sethe, a former slave haunted by the ghost of her deceased daughter.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The multi-generational story of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo, blending reality with fantastical elements.

title: On the Road
author: Jack Kerouac
description: A novel about the adventures of Sal Paradise and Dean Moriarty as they travel across America in search of meaning and experience.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
description: The story of Billy Pilgrim, who becomes 'unstuck in time' and experiences his life out of sequence, including his time as a POW in WWII.

title: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A satirical novel about American airmen in WWII, exploring the absurdity of war and bureaucratic paradoxes.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: The story of the Joad family's migration from Oklahoma to California during the Great Depression in search of a better life.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: The story of an orphaned girl who becomes a governess and falls in love with her brooding employer, Mr. Rochester.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A dark tale of passion and revenge centered on the tumultuous relationship between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge against the white whale that destroyed his ship and took his leg.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The classic vampire novel about Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England and the battle to stop him.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A young scientist creates a creature through scientific experimentation, exploring themes of creation, responsibility, and what makes us human.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: The story of Edmond Dantès, who is falsely imprisoned and later escapes to seek revenge against those who wronged him.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An epic novel following the lives of several aristocratic families during the Napoleonic era in Russia.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: The tragic story of Anna Karenina's affair and its consequences, alongside the contrasting story of Levin's search for meaning.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological drama about a poor student who commits murder and the mental anguish and moral dilemmas he faces afterward.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel exploring faith, doubt, and morality through the story of three brothers and their father's murder.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: The story of ex-convict Jean Valjean and his path to redemption in 19th-century France, exploring themes of justice, love, and sacrifice.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The adventures of an aging gentleman who reads so many chivalric romances that he decides to become a knight-errant himself.

title: Ulysses
author: James Joyce
description: A complex modernist novel that parallels Homer's Odyssey, following Leopold Bloom through a single day in Dublin.

title: Lolita
author: Vladimir Nabokov
description: A controversial novel about Humbert Humbert's obsession with twelve-year-old Dolores Haze, told through beautiful but disturbing prose.

title: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: The story of Gregor Samsa, who wakes up one morning transformed into a giant insect, exploring themes of alienation and humanity.

title: Kafka on the Shore
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A surreal story following a teenage boy who runs away from home and an elderly man who can talk to cats.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A nostalgic story of loss and sexuality set in 1960s Tokyo, following a college student caught between two very different women.

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A man's search for his missing cat and wife leads him into a surreal world of strange characters and mysterious events.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A groundbreaking cyberpunk novel about a washed-up computer hacker hired for one last job in cyberspace.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: The first book in Asimov's Foundation series, about psychohistory and the fall and rise of galactic civilizations.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
description: A brilliant young boy is recruited to attend a military academy in space to prepare for an alien invasion.

title: Stranger in a Strange Land
author: Robert A. Heinlein
description: A human raised by Martians returns to Earth and challenges human customs and beliefs with his alien perspective.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut stranded on Mars must use his scientific knowledge and ingenuity to survive until rescue is possible.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A human envoy visits a planet where inhabitants can change gender, exploring themes of sexuality, politics, and humanity.

title: Ready Player One
author: Ernest Cline
description: In a dystopian future, people escape reality through a virtual world called the OASIS, where a young man hunts for a hidden treasure.

title: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
description: A hacker and pizza delivery driver investigates a new drug called Snow Crash in a near-future America dominated by corporate franchises.

title: Hyperion
author: Dan Simmons
description: Seven pilgrims journey to the planet Hyperion, each telling their story Canterbury Tales-style in this epic space opera.

title: Contact
author: Carl Sagan
description: A scientist receives a message from extraterrestrial intelligence, leading to humanity's first contact with alien life.

title: Flowers for Algernon
author: Daniel Keyes
description: The story of Charlie Gordon, a man with intellectual disabilities who undergoes experimental surgery to increase his intelligence.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: In a future where books are banned and burned, a fireman begins to question his role in society's destruction of knowledge.

title: The Time Machine
author: H.G. Wells
description: A Victorian scientist travels to the year 802,701 and discovers humanity has evolved into two distinct species.

title: The Invisible Man
author: H.G. Wells
description: A scientist discovers how to make himself invisible but finds that the process drives him to madness and violence.

title: The War of the Worlds
author: H.G. Wells
description: Martians invade Earth with superior technology, bringing humanity to the brink of extinction in this classic alien invasion story.

title: The Island of Dr. Moreau
author: H.G. Wells
description: A man is shipwrecked on an island where a mad scientist conducts horrific experiments to transform animals into human-like beings.

title: Brave New World Revisited
author: Aldous Huxley
description: Huxley's non-fiction follow-up to his novel, examining how the world had moved toward his dystopian vision.

title: Walden
author: Henry David Thoreau
description: Thoreau's reflections on simple living in natural surroundings, based on his experiment living at Walden Pond.

title: Civil Disobedience
author: Henry David Thoreau
description: Thoreau's influential essay arguing that individuals should not permit government to override their conscience.

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
description: The personal writings of the Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, offering insights into Stoic philosophy and self-reflection.

title: The Republic
author: Plato
description: Plato's foundational work on justice, the ideal state, and the nature of reality, featuring the famous Allegory of the Cave.

title: Nicomachean Ethics
author: Aristotle
description: Aristotle's exploration of moral philosophy, examining what constitutes a good life and virtuous character.

title: Man's Search for Meaning
author: Viktor E. Frankl
description: A Holocaust survivor's account of his experiences in Nazi concentration camps and his psychotherapeutic method of finding meaning in suffering.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: A groundbreaking exploration of the two systems that drive the way we think: fast, intuitive thinking and slow, deliberate thinking.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A thought-provoking exploration of how Homo sapiens came to dominate the world, from the Stone Age to the present.

title: Homo Deus: A Brief History of Tomorrow
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: Harari's follow-up to Sapiens, exploring what the future might hold for humanity in an age of artificial intelligence and biotechnology.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: Hawking's accessible exploration of cosmology, black holes, and the nature of time and the universe.

title: The Selfish Gene
author: Richard Dawkins
description: Dawkins' influential book explaining evolution from the gene's perspective, introducing the concept of memes.

title: On the Origin of Species
author: Charles Darwin
description: Darwin's groundbreaking work introducing the theory of evolution by natural selection.

title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
author: Jared Diamond
description: An examination of how geography and environment shaped the fates of human societies throughout history.
